Convo: ^Did you see the audience? They were going nuts for us. I think we have a real shot at winning this thing.

c-0: ^I didn't even need to see them. I heard those cheers and chants for you guys up there. It was amazing!
c-1: ^We might have a real good shot at this if we can keep it up.

C1: ^Were they? I couldn't hear them all that well. I'll try and listen more closely for the cheers once we get back out there.

c-0: ^Could it be your bad ears? I've told you that you listen to music way too loud. Matching that with practicing with your amp right next to you is a bad combo.
^Crap. You might be right. I might need to go get them checked out after all.
c-1: ^Try and focus more on playing rather than listening to them. You don't want to be too focused on them that you screw up. It could cost us.
^You have a good point. Fine, I'll mainly worry about playing. But I still want to hear them cheering for us at some point.

C2: ^I think we can. All that practicing and gigs we've done aren't gonna go to waste. You just gotta be confident like me.

c-0: ^Already on it MJ. We just gotta keep playing our best and see what happens.
^Agreed. We need to crush all of the other bands that stand in our way too.
c-1: ^You always say that practice makes perfect. We're seeing right now how true you are with that.
^EXACTLY! That's why I always tell the others it.
^They need to know that it works.
